intro: Cryptantha confertiflora, commonly known as the denseflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are pinnate, and the flowers are usually pale blue to purple in color. Cryptantha confertiflora is often found in arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
